executive_summary: Demand for marketing consultants has been very strong during the current period despite significant volatility. COVID-19 hindered corporate profit and advertising expenditure, hindering the industry's performance. Despite this, spending on sales management and development consulting services rose as economic uncertainty caused businesses to seek more advice on managing their sales departments, contributing to a modest increase in revenue in 2020. Demand for marketing consulting services surged in 2021 and 2022 as the pandemic recovery caused corporate profit to skyrocket. Business income has declined over the past couple of years as rising interest rates have induced recessionary fears, contributing to a modest drop in revenue in 2023. Consultants are somewhat confident that rate cuts in 2024 will lessen recessionary fears, boost corporate profit and cause demand for

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Corporate Profit Levels are a Bellwether of Demand
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Businesses with higher profit are more likely to experiment with new marketing strategies and tactics, spurring demand for the industry's services. Elevated corporate profit also makes businesses more likely to hire marketing consultants on a retainer basis since they have the increased funds to do this, which provides a steady stream of revenue for providers.

Marketing consultants in the United States are highly fragmented, with nonemployers comprising more than three-quarters of establishments. Many small players are boutique consulting firms. These players focus on providing niche advice in specific areas of marketing and can remain competitive by offering their services at a fraction of the price of larger providers.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: There's growing demand for specialized marketing services
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Businesses have increasingly sought marketing consultants specializing in a particular industry or niche market. Companies want to work with providers who deeply understand their unique challenges and opportunities.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Customer experience is also a top priority for businesses
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Marketing consultants have recently jumped in and tried to help clients improve their experience. This includes assisting firms in developing customer-centric marketing strategies and using data and analytics to understand and meet the needs of their customers.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Demand will steady as the economy improves
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Despite challenges related to soaring inflation, rising interest rates and recessionary fears, economic growth will be stable and positive during the outlook period. Steady GDP growth will foster higher corporate profit, giving businesses the funds to spend on marketing consulting services. The strong economy will also encourage more business formation, boosting the supply

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Digitization Will Drive Growth in the Industry
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Customers will engage with companies and purchase products and services using an ever-expanding number of new devices. Marketing consultants will be called upon to provide technical advice and strategies for rolling out new products and services and targeting new audiences through online advertising. Businesses will increasingly seek marketing consultants who specialize in a particular industry or niche market. For this reason, marketing expenditures will continue to grow steadily despite declining demand from traditional media formats such as network TV and print newspapers.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Rising In-House Competition Will Threaten Providers' Performance
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Companies will likely begin hiring specialists to provide marketing expertise rather than outsourcing to help develop new marketing strategies or branding schemes. The industry may lose access to valuable revenue streams as external competition rises.

industry_definition: Marketing consultants provide operating advice and assistance to businesses and other organizations on marketing issues, such as developing marketing objectives and policies, sales forecasting, new product development and pricing, licensing and franchising planning and marketing planning and strategies.

negative_impact_factors: low - steady Barriers To Entry Level

key_trends: With minimal legal requirements and affordable start-up costs, new marketing consultants can enter the industry relatively easily. This leads to a competitive market with many small firms.

Marketing consultants often compete on price because of the high number of players, giving buyers significant bargaining power. Larger clients, in particular, can use their leverage to negotiate better deals.

Companies can substitute external marketing consultants with in-house teams or management consultants for broader strategic expertise. DIY marketing tools also offer small businesses a hands-on, budget-friendly option.

Businesses flush with excess profit are more inclined to experiment with marketing strategies and hire consultants, creating a steady revenue stream for the industry. Over the couple of years, recessionary fears reduced corporate profit and led many companies to cut back on marketing consulting services.

The marketing consulting landscape is highly fragmented with many boutique firms focusing on niche areas to offer cost-effective services. These smaller players can quickly adapt to market changes, making them a valuable option for businesses needing agility.

Companies are turning to consultants with expertise in specific industries to tackle unique challenges. Focus on improving customer experience and leveraging data analytics to tailor marketing strategies has become crucial.

Businesses will increasingly hire in-house specialists to reduce outsourcing costs, posing a threat to traditional marketing consulting firms. To stay competitive, consultants must offer highly specialized services and harness new technologies to add value and drive growth.
Large companies provide multiple services besides marketing consulting. Small enterprises can compete by specializing in a niche service or focusing on serving one industry.
The industry's most prominent players include businesses such as Accenture PLC, Publicis Groupe (Publicis) and WPP PLC

Marketing consultants' performance is reliant on the advertising budgets of their clientele. Many players operate on a project-based revenue model, where their earnings are tied to specific campaigns or initiatives.

Marketing consultants must adhere to laws such as the FTC Act and the FCC's advertising regulations, ensuring truthful advertising and respect for consumer privacy. Compliance with evolving legislation such as the California Consumer Privacy Act is crucial to avoid legal issues and protect consumer data.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Retail and wholesale companies rely on advertising to generate new sales, so they often use marketing consultants to create business. Knowledge of the most popular consumer trends and how consumers purchase goods is key to these industries.

Financial service companies continually analyze their position in the market and work on advertising and marketing campaigns to win new business. These companies aggressively sell to consumers and other businesses that use banks to process investments. To achieve these objectives, financial institutions use marketing consultants.

Private sector businesses that use marketing consultants include the manufacturing, energy and resources sectors. Over the past couple of years, high interest rates and recessionary fears have constrained corporate profit, so demand from these sectors declined, causing their revenue shares to creep downward during the current period.

Alternatively, technology, communications and healthcare businesses represent a growing source of revenue for marketing consultants since these industries are expanding as a share of the US economy. Many tech companies lack the in-house expertise or resources to effectively manage their marketing and sales efforts.

Private sector businesses that use marketing consultants include the manufacturing, energy and resources sectors. Over the past couple of years, high interest rates and recessionary fears have constrained corporate profit, so demand from these sectors declined, causing their revenue shares to creep downward during the current period.

Marketing consultants are hired to assist individuals and sole proprietors. Individuals typically pursue advice on planning and organization and how to enter a competitive market before opening a business. Sole proprietors engage in far less business compared to big corporations, so individuals comprise a fairly small proportion of revenue.

Government agencies and nonprofit organizations use consultants to roll out new campaigns and consumer awareness programs. While these campaigns and programs provide a decent revenue stream for the industry, governments and nonprofits don't sell products for a profit, so their need for marketing consultants isn't exceptionally high. For this reason, these customers comprise a pretty small share of revenue.

Government agencies and nonprofit organizations use consultants to roll out new campaigns and consumer awareness programs. While these campaigns and programs provide a decent revenue stream for the industry, governments and nonprofits don't sell products for a profit, so their need for marketing consultants isn't exceptionally high. For this reason, these customers comprise a pretty small share of revenue.

products_and_services.product_description: Marketing consultants provide advice and guidance on marketing strategy and other related issues. These include planning and organization, competitive analysis, customer analysis, marketing audits and market evaluation.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Marketing Strategy and Market Development Consulting Services
products_and_services.product_description: Consultants identify external opportunities and challenges for businesses and government organizations that can be addressed through marketing strategies.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Sales Management and Development Consulting Services
products_and_services.product_description: Sales management and development consulting services include advice on sales management topics such as strategy planning and organization, sales forecasting, sales compensation and sales training.
These services are sometimes offered independently. Most of the time, they're typically bundled together to provide an analysis of current systems before developing new strategies.

Other marketing consulting services include strategic management consulting, custom computer application design services, market research and polling. Players also provide public relations services, corporate development consulting services, operations and supply chain marketing management and other services.

tier_2_suppliers: Human Resources & Benefits Administration in the US
Payroll & Bookkeeping Services in the US
Health & Medical Insurance in the US
tier_1_buyers: Office Supply Stores in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Profit typically raises the number of businesses that can afford consulting services. For this reason, higher corporate profit precipitates increased Marketing Consultants' revenue.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast region comprises the largest share of the United States' population because it contains big states such as Florida, Georgia, Tennessee and North Carolina. The high population in this part of the US precipitates elevated demand for a range of goods, which generates investment in marketing and their related advisory services. As a result, more than one-quarter of marketing consultants are located in the Southeast.

California is home to more establishments than every other state because of their large population and the presence of booming, highly marketable industries such as film production and retail. California's importance to the Industry raises the significance of the entire West region for marketing consultants.

The Mid-Atlantic region has a diverse and dynamic economy with strengths in finance, technology, healthcare and government. The presence of large metropolitan areas such as New York, Philadelphia and Washington, DC, drive demand for these services. Marketing consultants can find various clients and industries to serve, contributing to business opportunities and growth.

The Great Lakes region is home to states such as Illinois, Ohio and Michigan. These states specialize in automobile manufacturing, steel making and other forms of goods production. The Plains region is the breadbasket of the United States, so they produce a large portion of the nation's foodstuffs.

The Great Lakes region is home to states such as Illinois, Ohio and Michigan. These states specialize in automobile manufacturing, steel making and other forms of goods production. The Plains region is the breadbasket of the United States, so they produce a large portion of the nation's foodstuffs.

regulations_points.regulation_description: This act was originally passed in 1914 and outlaws unfair methods of competition. Pertaining to this industry, this law requires advertising to be truthful and nondeceptive.

The FCC regulates advertising on radio and television, including rules regarding content, obscenity and sponsorship identification. Marketing consultants working with clients in the broadcasting industry need to be aware of these regulations when developing advertising campaigns.
In recent years, the data-driven nature of consulting work has led to rules concerning client data handling and cybersecurity.
Marketing consultants must respect intellectual property laws, ensuring that all content used in campaigns doesn't infringe on copyrights, trademarks or patents.

basis_points.basis_title: Minimal legal requirements and affordable start-up costs
basis_points.basis_description: With minimal legal requirements and affordable start-up costs, new marketing consultants can enter the industry relatively easily.

basis_points.basis_title: Price competition and buyer bargaining power
basis_points.basis_description: Marketing consultants often compete on price because of the high number of players, giving buyers significant bargaining power.

basis_points.basis_title: Substitution with in-house teams or DIY tools
basis_points.basis_description: Companies can substitute external marketing consultants with in-house teams or management consultants for broader strategic expertise.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Low barriers to entry and presence of niche firms fosters fragmentation
concentration_points.concentration_description: Regulation for marketing consultants is fairly light, start-up costs are pretty low and wage expenses are often manageable, creating low barriers to entry.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Niche firms specializing in specific areas
concentration_points.concentration_description: Marketing is a broad field with various specializations, including digital marketing, content marketing, social media management, search engine optimization (SEO), market research and more.
The industry contains several companies that control significant portions of the market.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Expanding Compensation and Price Undercutting Limit Profit
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Rising wage costs and the trend of price undercutting has put pressure on marketing consultants' net income.
Marketing consulting companies employ highly educated individuals who possess either a bachelor's or graduate degree in business or a related field.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: OTHER COSTS INCLUDE MANY DIFFERENT SERVICES
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Other costs relate to expenses such as accounting, insurance, bank service and legal fees.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Employees in marketing consulting are highly knowledgeable, attaining, at minimum, a bachelor's degree.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Corporate Profit Levels Contribute to Volatility
volatility_points.volatility_description: Marketing consulting revenue is linked to, but not determined solely by, macroeconomic conditions.
Advertising budgets help drive demand for marketing consultants specializing in developing branding, marketing and sales strategies.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: DIGITAL AND PERSONALIZED MARKETING SOLUTIONS ARE THE FUTURE
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Marketing consultants have increasingly incorporated advanced digital marketing solutions and technologies into their services.
With a growing emphasis on customer experience, marketing consultants are innovating in personalization.

FAQs.question: What are some key regulatory issues facing marketing consultants?
FAQs.answer: In recent years, marketing consultants have had to comply with consumer privacy laws.

FAQs.question: How have economic conditions affected demand for marketing consulting services?
FAQs.answer: Improving macroeconomic conditions have led to increased demand for marketing consultant services.

FAQs.question: Are there significant substitutes for marketing consulting services?
FAQs.answer: There are next to no substitutes for marketing consultants.

FAQs.question: How capital intensive are marketing consulting operations?
FAQs.answer: Marketing consulting is done by highly-skilled workers with little capital investment required.

FAQs.question: Do marketing consultants pursue mergers and acquisitions?
FAQs.answer: Marketing consultancy is primarily done by individuals.

FAQs.question: How do marketing consultants protect proprietary information?
FAQs.answer: Marketing consulting businesses make consultants sign non-disclosure agreements.

FAQs.question: Have new technologies increased competitiveness for marketing consultants?
FAQs.answer: There has been little technological advances that have meaningfully increased marketing consultants' efficiencies.

FAQs.question: Do marketing consultants benefit from government legislation?
FAQs.answer: Marketing consultants benefited from regulation such as the Affordable Care Act.

FAQs.question: Has the regulatory environment for marketing consultants changed significantly?
FAQs.answer: In recent years marketing consultants have not seen a meaningful increase in new regulatory measures.

FAQs.question: Has competition from low-wage countries impacted marketing consultants?
FAQs.answer: Since marketing consultants are highly-skilled workers, they have faced little to no competition.

FAQs.question: How do marketing consultants' profit margins compare to competitors?
FAQs.answer: Marketing consultants' profit margins vary primarily based on the clients they work for.

FAQs.question: How do marketing consultants compete for contracts during high demand?
FAQs.answer: Consulting firms are subject to high levels of competition and therefore must compete on price and service offerings.

FAQs.question: How important is word-of-mouth marketing for consultants?
FAQs.answer: Advisory services are highly labor intensive.

FAQs.question: How do marketing consultants attract and retain skilled staff?
FAQs.answer: Consultants are valuable for their education and experience.

FAQs.question: How do marketing consultants convince potential clients of their value?
FAQs.answer: As the business sentiment index increases reflecting an improving economic outlook, businesses are more likely to invest in marketing consultants.

FAQs.question: Do marketing consultants specialize in digital/online marketing?
FAQs.answer: As the number of broadband internet connections rises, so will the need for marketing consulting tailored to engaging customers.

FAQs.question: How do marketing consultants pursue new advertising clients?
FAQs.answer: As companies increase their total advertising expenditure, they are more likely to use marketing consultants.
